website_summaries.verdict: The support and traction from the lightweight Salomon Quest Prime GTX unquestionably made its average price all worth it. The pair is sturdy yet required little-to-no breaking-in. Its Contagrip technology is not left unnoticed, as well as its quality construction. The comfort of the backpacking boot which was tantamount to having no foot fatigue at all was also appreciated. No matter how perfect the boot may seem, some shortcomings still plague it. Upset consumers noted that the toe box is too wide and there are some issues with the laces. All in all, this Salomon offering may end up as a credible pair for backpackers because of its trail-related advantages, as long as buyers adjust to its shortcomings.
pros: A good number of backpackers enjoy the lightness of the boot
The slightly expensive price tag of the Salomon Quest Prime GTX is definitely worth it, according to numerous satisfied wearers
They mention that it held up perfectly, from groomed trails to the roughest terrains
The minimal-to-no break-in period astonishes several users
A lot of Salomon stalwarts admire the support the Quest Prime GTX gives
The superb construction and quality of the pair satisfy a couple of backpacking enthusiasts
A high percentage of reviewers like the comfort of Salomon’s Quest Prime GTX
They experience no foot fatigue after backpacking for miles
The waterproofing ability of the boot is truly admirable, according to a number of reviews
cons: A couple of Quest Prime GTX users detest the toe box of the pair
It is too wide that they felt like their feet were swimming inside the shoe
The laces frequently untie, according to some frustrated wearers
One expert is not too fond of the boot’s underwhelming aesthetics

customer_reviews.title: Will be returned.
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the boot however there are some things that need addressed. First, the toe “pops” with each step I take and it’s very annoying to say the least. I tried mink oil, wax and other leather softening products but they BOTH still pop as I walk. Second the Gortex is stitched inside the boot and they put a seam right where my heel sits and it rubs my foot creating a hot spot and eventually will cause blisters. I will be returning these and buying the tried and true Keens.
customer_reviews.author: rj raye

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, really light
customer_reviews.text: The boot fit as advertised, and the gortex really worked, and they are extremely light. I used the out in the snow storm to work around the yard, and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Best - No question about it.
customer_reviews.text: I can't think or find anything bad to say about these boots. They feel great, absolutely waterproof with gore-tex, extremely light weight and possibly the most comfortable pair of Footwear I have, period. I wear 10 1/2 and they fit perfect. Addition - I just got back from a 3 day hunting trip walking through swamp land, muck, mud & rough terrain - Absolutely no water at all got in my boots. 100 % dry inside. I call them my clouds!!
customer_reviews.author: To Help Others

customer_reviews.title: Requires a break-in period
customer_reviews.text: For all the larger men in the room, or average, I’m 6’ and 230 with a 13w. Out of the box I wore these on a 12 hour shift in ER and getting out of them was Heaven. Then I wore them another 12 hours just day to day, and then another. After 36 hours of wear they became comfortable. This is a rugged boot designed for hiking. After a low round hike in the swamps it stands up well. Keeps out water. I will say that there are more inexpensive boots that do the same.
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: Well made fit great comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Best boots I’ve ever worn this is my sixth pair they fit perfect and feel great right out of the box every time
customer_reviews.author: Curbshoppin

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear shoes size 8 1⁄2 , but in this kind of boots I wear two sizes up. I bought size 9 1⁄2 and they fit as expected. Very confortable for my feet. I read a review before I bought them that the rubber over the toes pop on every step. It is true. In terms of confort they are great
customer_reviews.author: TonySempertegui

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I chose this over the quest 4d. They are a similar boot. This has a lower ankle height and is lighter. Those were the deciding factors for me. I plan ok using these for back packing. I have owned several versions of this boot under different names and it’s my goto. The only concern I have is the eye loops. They are fabric. I wish they were the metal riveted ones. For my use this boot should be great. Comfortable out the box. Haven’t hit the trail yet but feel like my old pair of mission gtx.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the savings
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had incredible luck with Solomon until these. 3 sets of boots so far, 10.5 in all of them, perfect. Until now. I have bee breaking them in for a month, they’re very stiff, also difficult to put on compared to the more expensive models. Feels like the cut every corner possible. I thought I’d be saving some money, now I just want to throw them in the trash and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: David clauss

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, very comfortable and supportive...
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, I'm actually wearing them now, very little break-in required. Pay the extra money get these over some of the lesser expensive Solomon boots, these are super high quality, I have not been as impressed with the less expensive products.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes and would definitely purchase again. Very comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable, but not waterproof. I took the dog out to go to the bathroom, one lap around the block, in the rain. Now I go to take him out again, and the inside of the boots are all wet. (Update) They did dry out nicely by the next day, and they are still very comfortable. Adds a lot of stability to my footing in any condition.
customer_reviews.author: Shane W

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: My second Salomon and very happy with it and especially its comfortable width. Some people with sensitive feet may want to add a softer sole. In that case may need to get 1/2 size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Mourad

customer_reviews.title: Wsrm and dry
customer_reviews.text: My son works im the snow, they keep his feet earm and dry
customer_reviews.author: sherri walt

customer_reviews.title: So comfy, I forgot I bought new shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I buy new shoes every 10 mths or because I am tough on them. Today I noticed that I don't have any of that break-in pain. No stiffness, no rubbing, just boots that feel good. I like that.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Nothstein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stability on slippery rocky trails
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stability on the rocky trails in Maryland. Perfect for my section hikes on The AT. Lightweight and flexible but still provides great ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: N3WT John

customer_reviews.title: Buy the 3G's.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, not the usual Salomon comfy sole or craddled fit.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boots I have ever owned. High quality and very durable. It has excellent arch support and the material is very comfortable. I researched several brands and these live up to their reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort in one great pair of boots.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Quest primes for a little over a week and have already put 100 miles on them. They are amazingly comfortable with great foot and ankle support. Best boots I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot but color is off
customer_reviews.text: Great boot! Only issue is the color is a little off compared to the pic in the ad. The brown ones look a little green in color.
customer_reviews.author: T. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Love my Salomon
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. I have got about 120-150 miles on them they support you feet great
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: second pair of them and haven’t disappointed yet second trip out west for 2 weeks of backpack hunting elk and never had an issue with the last pair
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third pair. I have a very wide foot. And these fit me great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just one word: Salomon!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fantastic! Lightweight, waterproof, super comfortable, plenty of cool features that are hiking and backpacking specific... Overall, love them!
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: NEED TO BE BROKEN IN
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is a fine product, though I have not been in the cold with these boots. Take time to break these in. These aren't the Merrells to which I am accustomed. They are a different feel. I believe this purchase will work out.
customer_reviews.author: sapere18

customer_reviews.title: Tight
customer_reviews.text: I’m a boot snob and like comfortable boots because I’m in them all day. These arnt to bad, comfortable, waterproof, warm. Holding up well after 6 weeks. Little tight in the toe area but loosening up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda/Brad Strand

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable boot but does not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought the boot here a few years ago and just under a year the lower leather lace loop broke. Salomon has 2 year warranties on the boots so I got in touch with them and they gave me a credit for a new pair. I have had the new pair for just over one year and the sole started seperating from the boot. I contacted Salomon again and they said the 2 years was only from the initial purchase, not the replacement. I love the boots but they just don't seems to hold up. Pros: Very comfortable No break in time Cons: Don't last not the most aggressive tread water resistant, not water proof
customer_reviews.author: mattmers

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Shoes Quest Prime GTX Canteen/Wren/Mart Fitness
product_meta.description: Mountain boots Man from the brand Salomon. Model - quest shoes PRIME GTX canteen/wren/MARTIN reference 364267
feature_bullets: Lightweight : A lighter boot makes for an easier journey. At only 570G, Quest Prime GTX is one of the lightest boots in the backpacking category.
Comfort/ protection : a rubber toe cap protects feet from all kinds of hazards. A GORE-TEX membrane ensures breathable weather protection. Great cushioning for long distance comfort.
Athletic style : bridging the span between mountain heritage and athletic design cues. Salomon DNA expressed in this progressive yet clean silhouette.
